text: Janis Paige (born Donna Mae Tjaden; September 16, 1922 - June 2, 2024) was an American movie, musical theatre and television actress. She was born in Tacoma, Washington. Her career began in 1944. She retired in 2001. Paige made her live dramatic TV debut June 27, 1957, in "The Latch Key" on Lux Video Theatre. Paige appeared in many television shows during her career such as 87th Precinct (TV series),The Pat Boone Chevy Showroom, Trapper John, M.D., All in the Family, Columbo and Caroline in the City, and in the 1975 television movie John O'Hara's Gibbsville (also known as The Turning Point of Jim Malloy). Paige turned 100 on September 16, 2022. She died at her Los Angeles, California home on June 2, 2024, at the age of 101. ==References== ==Other websites== * * * Category:1922 births Category:2024 deaths Category:American stage actors Category:American television actors Category:Actors from Tacoma, Washington Category:American movie actors
title: Janis Paige
